title: Citi and the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi Honor and Thank U.S. Veterans, Military Families and Survivors at Citi Field
summary: New York, N.Y. - Citi and the New York Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi teamed up at Citi Field to honor and thank U.S. veterans, military families and survivors at a luncheon and panel discussion focusing on veterans' issues. Mets personnel and alumni, including Mets General Manager Sandy Alderson and Hall-of-Famer Tom Seaver, participated. The project is part of the Mets and Citi's "Teammates in the Community" initiative, reflecting their ongoing commitment to be active participants in the community.
tag-1: Citi and the Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi Honor and Thank U.S. Veterans, Military Families and Survivors at Citi Field
tag-3: New York, N.Y. – Citi and the New York Mets Alumni Association Presented by Citi teamed up at Citi Field to honor and thank U.S. veterans, military families and survivors at a luncheon and panel discussion focusing on veterans' issues. Mets personnel and alumni, including Mets General Manager Sandy Alderson and Hall-of-Famer Tom Seaver, participated. The project is part of the Mets and Citi's "Teammates in the Community" initiative, reflecting their ongoing commitment to be active participants in the community.
tag-4: Alderson and Seaver were joined by fellow Mets alumni Ed Charles, Bud Harrelson and Ed Kranepool in a panel moderated by Howie Rose, the radio voice of the Mets on Sports Radio 66 WFAN. Also on the panel was Team Citi athlete Carlos Leon, a U.S. Track & Field Paralympian and veteran of the U.S. Marine Corps who competed in the 2008 Paralympic Games in Beijing.
tag-5: "Citi is proud to honor the brave men and women who have served in the Armed Forces, and their families, and thank them for their contributions and sacrifices on behalf of our country," said Christopher Perkins, Citi's Global Head of Derivatives Clearing and a U.S. Marine veteran. "Citi is pleased to again join with the Mets to create a meaningful experience tomorrow at Citi Field. Events like this are part of Citi's ongoing efforts to provide support to veterans and their families during and after military service."
tag-6: At the luncheon, Citi and the Mets recognized a coalition of leading veterans' service organizations that are collaborating on CredAbility ReConnect, a free online financial education and counseling program funded by Citi Community Development that helps military families build financial capability and achieve long-term economic security. The coalition includes the Iraq and Afghanistan Veterans of America (IAVA), the Tragedy Assistance Program for Survivors (TAPS), the Military Spouse Corporate Career Network and CredAbility, a national nonprofit credit counseling organization. For more information on CredAbility ReConnect, visit www.credability.org/ReCon.
tag-7: During the evening's Mets game against the Colorado Rockies at Citi Field, Mets Alumni worked alongside volunteers from Citi and IAVA to encourage fans to sign welcome home cards for returning servicemembers at various locations throughout the ballpark. Additionally, Mets Alumni and Citi executives presented TAPS volunteer Mary Gallagher with the "Teammates in the Community Award" during a special pre-game ceremony. The award recognizes individuals who have demonstrated extraordinary efforts to give back to the community. Gallagher lost her husband while he was serving in the Marine Corps in 2006, and has since volunteered countless hours to provide newly bereaved survivors with support, compassion, and care during an extraordinarily difficult time.
tag-8: Citi volunteers at both events included members of the Citi Military Veterans Network - NYC, an employee-initiated and -led group focused on providing members with an opportunity to share common experiences and build awareness of issues important to the greater veterans' community. There are 15 Citi Military Veterans Networks established or in formation nationwide, which together play an important role in Citi Salutes™, the company's firm-wide initiative to develop programs and offerings that veterans, active-duty servicemembers, and their families need to realize their personal goals and professional aspirations. Citi Salutes provides a one-stop resource for information on career opportunities, money management tools, partnerships with veteran service organizations, and banking products and services tailored to the military and veteran community. For more information, visit www.citisalutes.com.
